title: Encryption
content:
Encryption model

OO Workflow Designer supports encryption and hash algorithms to protect sensitive data. Encryption is designed to prevent the exposure and modification of sensitive data, such as passwords, definitions, and so on, in OO Workflow Designer.

It is important to use well-known, standard algorithms without known vulnerabilities, in order to prevent decryption by unauthorized persons.

For example, SSL is not used, because of known vulnerabilities in the SSL protocol.

  • Static Data

All saved passwords are protected using well known algorithms and none are left in clear text. For example, the database passwords are encrypted.

  • Data in-transit

OO Workflow Designer uses the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol to encrypt the data between components.

  • Disabling the HTTP port

It is recommended to disable the HTTP port, for security reasons, so that the only communication channel will be on TLS and encrypted.

Encryption administration

  • Default Configuration Set
    • Symmetric-key algorithm: AES with key size 128
    • Hashing algorithm: SHA1
  • Advanced Settings
    OO Workflow Designer uses the following security algorithm:
    • Symmetric-key algorithm: AES256
    • Hashing algorithm: SHA256

Digital certificates

A digital certificate is an electronic "passport" for a person, server, station, and so on.

To use encryption between a browser and the OO Workflow Designer server, you need to install a digital certificate on the server side.

OO Workflow Designer uses the Java Keytool utility to manage cryptographic keys and trusted certificates. This utility is included in the OO Workflow Designer installation folder, in <installation dir>/java/bin/keytool.

Certificate Location

Installations of OO Workflow Designer include two files for the management of certificates using Keytool:

  • <installation dir>/designer/var/security/client.truststore: Contains the list of trusted certificates
  • <installation dir>/desginer/var/security/key.store: Contains the OO Workflow Designer private certificate (including the private key)

Access Control to KeyStore and TrustStore

It is recommended that the TrustStore and KeyStore are stored with read permissions only for the user that runs the OO Workflow Designer service.

Replacing the OO Workflow Designer Self-signed Certificate

It is recommended to replace the OO Workflow Designer self-signed certificate after a new installation of OO Workflow Designer or if your current certificate has expired.

Part of the process of replacing the certificate is generating a PKCS12 format certificate, using your CA. Contact your CA for specific details about the certification process or refer to your corporate policy.
